CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: The onset of oxidation potentials ( E ox ) of PIDT - EHNT , PIDT - DTNT and PIDT-C12NT referred to ferrocene / ferrocenium ( Fc / Fc + ) were 0.68 , 0.68 , and 0.72 V , respectively with the corresponding calculated HOMO energy levels of -5.48 , -5.48 , and -5.52 eV according to the equation of HOMO = -e(E ox + 4.80 ) ( eV ). The LUMO energy levels were calculated from the difference of the HOMO energy levels and optical band gaps according to the equation : LUMO = ( HOMO + E opt g ) eV , which lies in the range of -3.79 ∼ -3.88 eV. The electrochemical data are summarized in Table 1. All polymers showed very deep HOMO levels of ca. -5.5 eV , which were much lower than the reported benzodithiophene-NT ( PBDT - DTNT ) based poly- mers , 20 illustrating that IDT was a good donor unit that can offer deep HOMO level and high V oc of the PSCs based on the target polymers can be anticipated. Mobility. Hole mobility of donor polymers played an important role in the OPV performance of the resulting PSCs. 53 In order to evaluate the hole mobility of the resulting polymers , corresponding hole - only devices with configuration o f I T O / p o l y ( 3 , 4 -e t h y l e n e d i o x y t h i o p h e n e ) : p o l y -(styrenesulfonate) ( PEDOT : PSS ) / polymer / MoO 3 / Al were fabricated and the hole mobilities were obtained by using the space charge limited current ( SCLC ) model. The calculated hole mobilities of PIDT - EHNT , PIDT - DTNT , and PIDT-C12NT were 9.84 × 10^-5 , 1.66 × 10^-4 , and 2.42 × 10^-4 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 , respectively. When considering that PIDT-C12NT shows higher hole mobility and superior absorption to that of PIDT - EHNT and PIDT - DTNT , it is rational to envisage that PIDT-C12NT would achieve superior processability and backbone planarity among three polymers. Morphology. Insight into the nanoscale surface topography of the polymer : PC71BM blend films with weight ratio of 1 : 2 were carried out by tapping mode atomic force microscopy ( AFM ). As can be seen in Figure 5 , blend films based on PIDT - EHNT and PIDT - DTNT with PC71BM showed unexpected phase separation , with corresponding domain size over 200 and 100 nm , respectively which are much larger than typical exciton diffusion length of ca. 10 nm. 54,55 In contrast , PIDT-C12NT based blend film displayed an interpenetrating bicontinuous network between polymer and PC71BM with optimal domain size of 10-20 nm that is pretty favorable for efficient diffusion of excitons to donor - acceptor interface.

Let's think step by step.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

1. PIDT - EHNT
2. PIDT - DTNT
3. PIDT-C12NT
4. PC71BM
5. polymer (this is a general term, but since it's used in the context of materials, I'll include it)

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PIDT - EHNT |
| PIDT - DTNT |
| PIDT-C12NT |
| PC71BM |
| polymer |

PV.content:
Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: The onset of oxidation potentials ( E ox ) of PIDT - EHNT , PIDT - DTNT and PIDT-C12NT referred to ferrocene / ferrocenium ( Fc / Fc + ) were 0.68 , 0.68 , and 0.72 V , respectively with the corresponding calculated HOMO energy levels of -5.48 , -5.48 , and -5.52 eV according to the equation of HOMO = -e(E ox + 4.80 ) ( eV ). The LUMO energy levels were calculated from the difference of the HOMO energy levels and optical band gaps according to the equation : LUMO = ( HOMO + E opt g ) eV , which lies in the range of -3.79 ∼ -3.88 eV. The electrochemical data are summarized in Table 1. All polymers showed very deep HOMO levels of ca. -5.5 eV , which were much lower than the reported benzodithiophene-NT ( PBDT - DTNT ) based poly- mers , 20 illustrating that IDT was a good donor unit that can offer deep HOMO level and high V oc of the PSCs based on the target polymers can be anticipated. Mobility. Hole mobility of donor polymers played an important role in the OPV performance of the resulting PSCs. 53 In order to evaluate the hole mobility of the resulting polymers , corresponding hole - only devices with configuration o f I T O / p o l y ( 3 , 4 -e t h y l e n e d i o x y t h i o p h e n e ) : p o l y -(styrenesulfonate) ( PEDOT : PSS ) / polymer / MoO 3 / Al were fabricated and the hole mobilities were obtained by using the space charge limited current ( SCLC ) model. The calculated hole mobilities of PIDT - EHNT , PIDT - DTNT , and PIDT-C12NT were 9.84 × 10^-5 , 1.66 × 10^-4 , and 2.42 × 10^-4 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 , respectively. When considering that PIDT-C12NT shows higher hole mobility and superior absorption to that of PIDT - EHNT and PIDT - DTNT , it is rational to envisage that PIDT-C12NT would achieve superior processability and backbone planarity among three polymers. Morphology. Insight into the nanoscale surface topography of the polymer : PC71BM blend films with weight ratio of 1 : 2 were carried out by tapping mode atomic force microscopy ( AFM ). As can be seen in Figure 5 , blend films based on PIDT - EHNT and PIDT - DTNT with PC71BM showed unexpected phase separation , with corresponding domain size over 200 and 100 nm , respectively which are much larger than typical exciton diffusion length of ca. 10 nm. 54,55 In contrast , PIDT-C12NT based blend film displayed an interpenetrating bicontinuous network between polymer and PC71BM with optimal domain size of 10-20 nm that is pretty favorable for efficient diffusion of excitons to donor - acceptor interface.

Let's think step by step.

1. Oxidation potentials (E ox) of PIDT-EHNT, PIDT-DTNT, and PIDT-C12NT referred to ferrocene/ferrocenium (Fc/Fc+) are 0.68 V, 0.68 V, and 0.72 V, respectively.
2. Calculated HOMO energy levels of PIDT-EHNT, PIDT-DTNT, and PIDT-C12NT are -5.48 eV, -5.48 eV, and -5.52 eV, respectively.
3. The LUMO energy levels of the polymers are in the range of -3.79 eV to -3.88 eV.
4. Hole mobility of PIDT-EHNT, PIDT-DTNT, and PIDT-C12NT are 9.84 × 10^-5, 1.66 × 10^-4, and 2.42 × 10^-4 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1, respectively.
5. The domain size of PIDT-EHNT and PC71BM blend film is over 200 nm.
6. The domain size of PIDT-DTNT and PC71BM blend film is over 100 nm.
7. The domain size of PIDT-C12NT and PC71BM blend film is 10-20 nm.

Note: eV stands for electron volts and is a unit of energy, and V stands for volts and is a unit of electric potential difference. cm^2 V^-1 s^-1 stands for square centimeters per volt-second and is a unit of mobility. nm stands for nanometers and is a unit of length.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

2. Calculated HOMO energy levels of PIDT-EHNT, PIDT-DTNT, and PIDT-C12NT are -5.48 eV, -5.48 eV, and -5.52 eV, respectively.
3. The LUMO energy levels of the polymers are in the range of -3.79 eV to -3.88 eV.
4. Hole mobility of PIDT-EHNT, PIDT-DTNT, and PIDT-C12NT are 9.84 × 10^-5, 1.66 × 10^-4, and 2.42 × 10^-4 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1, respectively.
5. The domain size of PIDT-EHNT and PC71BM blend film is over 200 nm.
6. The domain size of PIDT-DTNT and PC71BM blend film is over 100 nm.
7. The domain size of PIDT-C12NT and PC71BM blend film is 10-20 nm.

Note: eV stands for electron volts and is a unit of energy, V stands for volts and is a unit of electric potential difference, cm^2 V^-1 s^-1 stands for square centimeters per volt-second and is a unit of mobility, and nm stands for nanometers and is a unit of length.
